admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
This report reviews the preparation,
            implementation and achievements of the Kosovo Water Supply
            Project. Major Loan conditions were met. However, instead of
            using consultants to assist in project supervision, the
            Borrower decided to do it with his own staff and did it
            successfully. The major project objectives of eliminating
            serious water shortages and strengthening the Borrower were
            accomplished. The institutional objective of developing
            Regional Waterworks Batlava (RWB) into a well run regional
            water supply and sewerage organization was accomplished. An
            excellent rapport existed between the Borrower and the Bank
            which was facilitated by the high degree of motivation and
            dynamism prevailing among RWB management and staff. The
            project represents the least cost solution. It was well
            conceived and well prepared. Major works were completed in a
            timely fashion. The primary objectives of improving water
            supply service in the project area and of developing RWB
            were achieved. The project confirms the need to properly
            factor the effect of price contingencies in cost estimates
            when local and foreign inflation are projected to be
            substantially different.
